content: Who is known for saying, "I think, therefore I am"?

René Descartes is known for saying, "I think, therefore I am." This statement is often referred to in Latin as "Cogito, ergo sum." It is a fundamental element of his philosophy and is considered a cornerstone of modern Western philosophy. The statement suggests that the very act of doubting one's own existence serves as proof of the reality of one's own mind—the thinker.
